body.p: The Model Context Protocol options allow you to configure how the Oxygen AI Positron Assistant connects to and interacts with MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers and tools. These settings are available in Options Preferences Plugins Oxygen AI Positron Assistant Model Context Protocol :

dlentry.dd: Specifies the path to the MCP configuration file (for example, ${pd}/positron-ai-actions/mcp-config.json). This file defines the available MCP servers and tools. You can use the folder icon to browse for a file, or click Configuration file structure for more information about the expected format.
Sets the maximum time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to an MCP server before timing out. The default value is 10 seconds.
If selected, enables the use of MCP servers running on the local machine. This option is useful for development or testing with local server instances.

dlentry.dt: Add provided tools to all chat modes
dlentry.dd: If selected, the tools defined in the MCP configuration file are made available in all chat modes of the AI Positron Assistant.
Displays the current status of the MCP configuration and connection. For example, if the configuration file is not found, an error message is shown with the file path.

dlentry.dt: Allow running the Oxygen XML application as a local MCP server (Experimental)
dlentry.dd: If selected, allows the Oxygen XML application itself to act as a local MCP server. This is an experimental feature and may be subject to change.

body.p: At the bottom of the dialog, you can choose whether these settings apply globally or only to the current project by selecting Global Options or Project Options.
Use the Restore Defaults button to reset all options to their default values. Click OK to save changes, Cancel to discard changes, or Apply to apply changes without closing the dialog.
